text:
I can't believe
you swapped our powers.

I also can't believe that
my mother is stronger than I am.
( grunts )
Oh, believe it, baby.

I have the strength
of 20 muscleheads.

Could've done without
the hairy back though.

What am I supposed to do
with electrical powers?

They're not nearly as cool
as my super strength.
No offense.
None taken.

Hey, what's that
on your face there?
Where?

You see, it's funny
because it's painful.
No offense.

Okay, looks like
all we have to do

to get your powers back is
hook you up to the device again

- and reverse the process.
- Great. Let's do it.
Come on, Eva. Now you.
I don't wanna.

What do you mean,
you "don't wanna"?
I like having super strength.

It will really
get my point across
to people who drive me crazy.

- See?
- Eva, honey.

You not having
electrical powers isn't natural.
It's like toast without jelly

or ice cream without
little rainbow sprinkles.

You're just afraid
that if I get mad,

I might use my super strength
to crush your head.

Am I not supposed
to care about my head?

Mom, it's not
that we don't want you

to have my strength,
it's just that--

She's staring at me.
I'm frightened.

I think what Jake
is trying to say

is you do have
a bit of a temper.
( yelling )
And there it is.

- do not have...
- ( rumbling )
...a temper! Aah!
Eva: Okay. Now I see it.
You can turn me back.
